title: How technology allowed me to read
description: Months after he was born, in 1948, Ron McCallum became blind. In this charming, moving talk, he shows how he reads -- and celebrates the progression of clever tools and adaptive computer technologies that make it possible. With their help, and the help of volunteers, he's become a lawyer, an academic, and, most of all, a voracious reader. Welcome to the blind reading revolution.
author: Ron McCallum
keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, choice, design, disability, sight, technology, books, blindness
